page.title: 12LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: WICKHAMBROOK has a Parish Council with seven Councillors and a part-time Clerk. PC Meetings are held in the Church Room every 6 or 7 weeks. Public attendance at PC Meetings or at the Annual Parish Meeting for all (987) electors is tiny, unless a controversial issue is to be discussed. The penny rate product is about #930. The PC is responsible for burials, footpaths (47 in W'brook), vets planning applications, advises District and County Councils on local needs. COWLINGE also has a P.C. but DENSTON is not big enough and has only an annual Parish Meeting.
